ARABIC: أَن لَّا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا ٱلْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُم مِّسْكِينٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: 'Do not let any poor man into it today while you are there.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Let no needy person come to you within it today."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: “No destitute person shall enter it today.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Let no beggar come to the garden".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “Make sure that no needy person enters your garden this day.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: No poor person shall enter upon you into it today."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Saying: No poor man shall enter it today upon you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: No needy man shall enter it today against your will.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: No needy man shall enter it to-day against you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Be sure to stop any poor person from entering the orchard today."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Let there not enter upon you today any needy man.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: ‘Today no needy man shall come to you in it.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Let not a single indigent person break in upon you into the (garden) this day."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: No Miskin (poor man) shall enter upon you into it today.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: No needy person shall set foot in it today'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: “No poor person is to enter it upon you today.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [Saying], "There will surely not enter it today upon you [any] poor person."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [68:24] ‘No needy person shall today come to you in it’ (this constitutes the explication of the preceding [verse]; or else, an relates to the verbal action, [to be understood] to mean bi-an).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: No needy man shall enter it) i.e. the garden (today against you.
